meanings.definition: A movable barrier used to open and close an entrance or exit.
meanings.sent1: The doors of the house swung open with a creak.
meanings.sent2: Please remember to close the doors behind you when you leave.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat learned to open the doors and explore the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the doors of the sky seemed to open to reveal a beautiful starry night.
meanings.sent5: The ancient castle's doors were adorned with intricate carvings and designs.

meanings.definition: The entrance to a building or room.
meanings.sent1: She stood nervously in front of the doors of the audition room.
meanings.sent2: The automatic doors slid open as we approached the grocery store.
meanings.sent3: The doors to the magical kingdom could only be opened by a special key.
meanings.sent4: His smile lit up the room as he walked through the doors of the party.
meanings.sent5: The heavy wooden doors of the cathedral were decorated with colorful stained glass.

meanings.definition: A means of access or opportunity.
meanings.sent1: Education can open doors to a brighter future.
meanings.sent2: Networking can help you find new doors of opportunity in your career.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected job offer knocked on her doors just when she needed it.
meanings.sent4: Traveling to new countries can broaden your horizons and open doors to different cultures.
meanings.sent5: The mentorship program provided students with doors to explore various career paths.
